subject: Psychology
title: Schachter's Two-Factor Theory
description: A micro-lesson that makes Schachter's Two-Factor Theory usable.

hook.text: Your heart is racing. Are you excited or scared? It depends on how you interpret the situation.

buildup.text: Schachter and Singer proposed that emotion requires two things: physical arousal AND a cognitive label.

discovery.text: In their 1962 study, people injected with adrenaline felt happy or angry depending on social context.

twist.text: The same racing heart becomes excitement on a roller coaster and panic in a dark alley. Context is everything.

climax.text: Your brain doesn't just feel arousal ‚Äî it searches for an explanation and labels the emotion accordingly.

punchline.text: Same body, different story, different emotion.

quiz.question: What two factors does Schachter's theory require for emotion?
options: Physical arousal and a cognitive label
